item.title: Earthquake Detection from Mobile & Edge Devices
item.description:
Overview

This study investigates earthquake detection using data collected from mobile phones and edge devices.

Dataset

  • Accelerometer
  • Gyroscope
  • Mobile crowdsensing data

Methodology

Signal preprocessing, feature extraction, and statistical analysis were applied to identify seismic patterns.

Findings

The results show that mobile-based sensing can complement traditional seismometer networks.

Conclusion

This work demonstrates the feasibility of large-scale, low-cost earthquake monitoring using edge devices.
